intro: Sedum reflexum subsp. aureum, commonly known as golden sedum, is a succulent plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It features fleshy, upright stems that are often tinged with yellow or orange, giving it its common name. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped yellow flowers during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its drought tolerance and low maintenance requirements make it a popular choice for gardeners in arid climates.
